items.sentence: Why do you always want to do things the hard way?
Why do you have such a negative approach to life?
Why do you keep looking in your rear-view mirror?
It isn\'t easy to write a love letter in English.
I don\'t think Tom wants to be my friend anymore.
I\'m glad I have a friend like you to confide in.
I\'m going to do something by myself for a while.
I\'m on my way to visit a friend in the hospital.
Tom encouraged Mary to learn how to speak French.
Tom enlisted in the army when he was 18 year old.
Everything is becoming more and more complicated.
Excuse me, can you lower your voice a little bit?
Tom told Mary he didn\'t want to see her anymore.
Tom told Mary that she shouldn\'t go there alone.
Tom said he couldn\'t do what we asked him to do.
Tom said he didn\'t know why Mary had to do that.
Tom said he didn\'t know why Mary went to Boston.
It wouldn\'t take so much time for me to do that.
I told myself that I\'d never be able to do that.
Tom cleared the table and Mary washed the dishes.
She followed him home to find out where he lived.
I was ill at ease because I didn\'t speak French.
Have you heard the original version of this song?
Have you made all the arrangements for your trip?
Tom says his teacher gives him too much homework.
Why don\'t you tell me why you think it happened?
It wasn\'t as expensive as I thought it would be.
Tom didn\'t trust Mary and she didn\'t trust him.
I believe you\'re trying to take advantage of me.
I bet it\'s not the first time Tom has done that.
I bought forty dollars\' worth of gasoline today.
I came to tell you that you don\'t need to worry.
I can\'t understand anything that foreigner says.
I\'ve just now finished doing my French homework.
I suppose that\'s why you don\'t like me so much.
Yesterday, Tom told me he couldn\'t speak French.
Let\'s hope the situation doesn\'t get any worse.
I couldn\'t figure out what he was talking about.
I couldn\'t go out on account of the bad weather.
I couldn\'t make myself heard in the noisy class.
I couldn\'t run fast enough to keep up with them.
Tom\'s will is going to be read tomorrow at 2:30.
We\'ll go hiking tomorrow if the weather\'s good.
What\'s the name of the disease that Tom died of?
You\'re the most beautiful woman I\'ve ever seen.
What\'s a picture like that doing in Tom\'s room?
It would\'ve been nice if you\'d told me earlier.
After an absence of ten months, he returned home.
Would you mind if I searched through Tom\'s room?
Would you tell Tom why we don\'t want to do that?
